title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey proposes eliminating the 15-year statute of limitations for rape cases with DNA evidence in Massachusetts.
The proposal requires that sexual assault evidence kits be stored for at least 15 years and tested within 30 days.
Healey's plan includes a five-year statewide strategy to address sex trafficking, with nearly 200 action steps.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Patriots released a hype video featuring coach Mike Vrabel ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks on Sunday.
The video emphasizes team identity and performance, focusing on enhancing individual and group potential in New England.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs is featured in the video, motivating teammates with the phrase, 'Ain’t nobody like us.'

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, pled guilty to charges of video voyeurism and obstruction for recording female co-workers at a Westminster post office.
The hidden camera was discovered March 2025 in the women's restroom, and Testagrossa attempted to destroy evidence afterward.
Testagrossa faces up to 20 years in prison and will be sentenced on May 12, 2026; fines may reach $250,000.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jewish groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford's values-based investment ordinance, claiming it mandates divestment based on ideology.
The ordinance prevents investments in sectors like fossil fuels and defense, affecting city and pension-related funds in Medford.
The lawsuit argues the policy conflicts with Massachusetts investment rules, prioritizing political criteria over financial returns.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need an MVP-level performance from QB Drake Maye against the Seahawks' stout defense for a Super Bowl win.
New England's defensive line, led by Milton Williams and Christian Barmore, aims to pressure Seattle QB Sam Darnold.
Patriots corner Christian Gonzalez to match up with Seahawks' top receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba in critical moments.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted No. 55 at USC, a tradition started by Junior Seau, and continued it with the Patriots.
From 1994 to 2005, McGinest wore No. 55 for New England, becoming the team's second all-time sack leader.
Junior Seau joined the Patriots in 2006, receiving McGinest's blessing to wear No. 55 during his tenure.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snowfall with select areas like Salisbury and Beverly recording up to 13 inches.
Bristol County saw varied snowfall, with the maximum recorded being 8.2 inches near Dartmouth.
Snowfall in Middlesex County reached up to 7 inches, notably near Marlborough and Winchester.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, featuring the Patriots and Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Tirico will follow his Super Bowl broadcast by hosting NBC's Olympic studio program from Levi's Stadium.
Tirico and analyst Cris Collinsworth will be joined by Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung on the sidelines.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium.
Quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest QB to win a Super Bowl if the Patriots win.
The Seahawks have been a strong defensive team, leading the league in scoring defense this season.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid for coaching advice before his first Super Bowl against the Seahawks.
Vrabel also relied on Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, who is heading into his 10th Super Bowl, for preparation tips.
The Patriots practiced simulating a Super Bowl halftime break, a strategy used by Belichick and Reid in their past successes.
